CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 16, 1945. p. 13, reads: "An Education, And How! - Fifth Avenue Students are pictured in one of the many stunt acts exhibited last Thursday night when the Physical Education Department held its annual show. The boys are doing a real act which would take most of the grownups years of education plus: These boys have won a number of sports awards." - Harris Photo.Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1945, p. 17, reads: "Win Sportsmanship Awards - These two boys, both students at Fifth Avenue High School, were honored last week at Roosevelt Hotel for having been chosen winners of the Sportsmanship Awards, presented each year by the Optomist [Optomist] Club.  William Turner, left, won the senior high school honor, while Praise Garner won the junior high school prize.  Harvey LeCollier is director of the Fifth Avenue physical education department. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Gymnasts William Turner and Praise Garner standing on stage for Fifth Avenue High School Physical Education Department annual show
